lines.content: ### Duke is a desktop application for managing tasks, used through the Command Line Interface (CLI).
### 1. Ensure you have Java 11 installed in you Computer.
### 3. Copy the jar file into a new folder.
### 4. Open a terminal and cd into the new folder. Use `java -jar ip.jar` to run Duke.
### 5. Refer to the Features below for each command.
#### Adds a Todo task into the taskslist.
#### Adds a Deadline task into the taskslist.
#### Adds an Event task into the taskslist.
#### Displays all tasks and their corresponding status.
#### Mark task as done by index in taskslist.
#### Unmark task by index in taskslist.
#### Delete task by index in taskslist.
#### Find task by name (case sensitive) in tasklist.
#### Saves tasks and exits the program.
public static String invalidAddTaskMessage = "Please the input correct task parameters!";
public static String invalidCommandMessage = "Please input a valid command!";
public static String invalidFindTaskMessage = "Please input a task to find!";
public static String taskListOutOfBoundsMessage = "The task you want to mark/unmark/delete is not found!";
* Handles the execution of the command specified by the user's input
* Executes the corresponding methods to the user's input command
* Catches the exceptions thrown from the corresponding methods
System.out.println("Please type an integer behind mark/unmark/delete!");
System.out.println("Pls enter the date in format yyyy-mm-dd!");
* Handles the initialsation and running of the main program Duke
* Handles the reading and writing to and from the duke.txt file
* File f represents the duke.txt file
public static File f = new File("duke.txt");
* Reads the duke.txt file into the Tasklist taskslist
* Creates a new duke.txt if the file does not exist
* Scanner s represents the scanner used in reading the file
* @throws IOException if there is an input/output error
* Write the encoded tasks in taskslist into the file
* FileWriter fw represents the FileWriter used in writing the file
* @throws IOException if there is an input/output error
* Initailises readIntoList() method when duke is started
* Catches the IOException throw by readIntoList()
* Tasklist taskslist is the arraylist containing all the tasks
public static ArrayList<Task> tasksList = new ArrayList<Task>();
